citeinfo.origin: Fisheries and Oceans Canada - Ocean Science And Productivity, Pacific
citeinfo.title: Georgia Strait - Production and Flux Observations, 1995-1999
citeinfo.othercit: Publications: O`Brien, M.C., M. Soon, B. Nielsen, C. Elliot, T. Juhasz, R.W. Macdonald, K.L. Denman, R.E. Thomson, S.E. Calvert. 2000. Sediment Trap from Georgia Strait, July 1995 to January 1999. Can. Data Rep. Hydrogr. Ocean Sci.: Geographic Areas: Strait of Georgia, Juan de Fuca Strait, and Haro Strait

descript.abstract: Observations of physical, biological, sedimentation and chemical parameters in Georgia Strait, 1995-1999.
descript.purpose: Seasonal cycles of particulate flux out of surface waters, primary production; physical and chemical properties of Haro Strait and Juan de Fuca Strait; nutrient supply/export mechanisms; Euphausiid distribution and stock assessment.
descript.supplinf: Risk Justification: Data are in electronic format, well backed up and well documented. Risk of Loss: Low Impact Justification: Time series of 5 to 10 years Impact of Loss: Medium Recommended Action: None Additional Info: Other researchers collaborated in these cruises: Coring in the Strait of Georgia for tracer and contaminant concentrations (R. Macdonald, MEHS, IOS), Tests of CTD-turbulence probe (A. Gargett, OSAP, IOS). The isotope ratios were determined at UBC.

place.placekey: South Inner Coast (Johnstone, Georgia, JDF, inlets and passages)

idinfo.useconst: Juan de Fuca-Haro chemical data are private--not quality checked, not published. Sediment trap/ CTD /GS data are departmentally accessible after proprietary period.

cntaddr.address: Institute of Ocean Sciences, P.O. Box 6000, 9860 West Saanich Road

dataqual.logic: Normal calibration of CTD instruments at IOS, calibration of nutrient analyzer with commercial standards, standard seawater (salinity), calibration of fluorometer with commercial standards,
dataqual.complete: Dataset Complications: The accuracy of the CTD data may vary depending on the instruments used and whether collaborating data were collected for intercomparison purposes. Guildline CTDs are standardized at IOS; Sea-Bird CTD`s are calibrated at Sea-Bird Electronics in Bellevue, Washington. Electronic Data Complications: Null

procstep.procdesc: Collaborative data with IOS, UBC and PBS

cntaddr.address: Institute of Ocean Sciences, P.O. Box 6000, 9860 West Saanich Road

stdorder.nondig: Hardcopy Original Exists: Y Hardcopy Locations: Joseph Linguanti, Rm 1246 (cruise logs), Mary O`Brien, Rm 2429 IOS(sediment traps) Hardcopy Description: Cruise logs, data sheets and cruise reports (J. Linguanti); sediment trap data sheets (M. O`Brien).
